hotspots.label: Long Antennae
hotspots.fact: Grasshoppers use their long antennae to feel their surroundings and detect vibrations in the air. These antennae help them find food and sense danger from predators nearby.

hotspots.label: Powerful Hind Legs
hotspots.fact: A grasshopper's back legs are incredibly strong and can launch it 20 times its own body length! These muscular legs are specially designed for jumping to escape danger.

hotspots.label: Plant Seed Head
hotspots.fact: Grasshoppers are herbivores that eat plants, seeds, and grains. This seed head provides nutritious food for the grasshopper to munch on throughout the day.

hotspots.label: Large Compound Eyes
hotspots.fact: Grasshoppers have huge eyes that can see in many directions at once, helping them spot movement and predators. Their excellent vision helps them navigate through grass quickly.
